If you want to identify the real rulers of any society, simply ask yourself this question: Who is it that I cannot criticize?
 
 The proof of these words is to be found in the recent imprisonment of the free thinkers who dared to question the ruling myths -- multiracialism and 'the Holocaust' -- of the Jewish power structure that rules the governments of the West today.
 
 Let's take a look at the fates of these brave men.
 
 Germar Rudolf is a man who made an objective investigation of 'Holocaust' sites and found that Jewish claims were untrue and in fact impossible: he was just kidnapped from the United States and imprisoned in Germany for publishing the results of his scientific tests.
 
 David Irving is a British historian and one of the greatest writers, scholars, and investigators of our time, who discovered that many Jewish historical claims were false or exaggerated: he made a speech in 1989 discussing his discoveries, and he was just arrested in Austria because of his speech of over 16 years ago.
 
 Siegfried Verbeke is a Flemish writer and researcher who has questioned Jewish accounts of WWII in his writings: he was arrested in his home country of Belgium through the use of a so-called European Arrest Warrant issued by Germany -- based on statements he made while in Belgium.

post_info.post_title: The only raace that matters is the human race!

Axolotl

U.S. Army has graphic film footage of American soldiers arriving in the concentration camps, the piles of dead, the many skeletal people barely alive. Some of this foot is shown on the recent Ken Burns, "The War," including army filming of a town of German citizens who lived near by the concentration camp with the smell from the ovens thick in the air of their daily lives. The American soldiers were so affected by the discovery of the camp and the seemingly indifferent townspeople living beside it, that they made the townspeople collect and bury all the bodies down what appeared to be fairly main street. Then they arrived, as mandated by the soldiers, and lay flowers on the various graves in a memorial service.
 
 it is strange to me that any person would want to deny this horrific period of history and what happened. Especially when it has been so well documented by so many people, with survivors still alive today, though mostly elderly.
 
 I suppose they deny it out of hate and guilt, shame, and some need to rationalize an event they feel responsible for, in some way. Even if they weren't there, themselves.
Joel_Henderson

Joel_Henderson

Look, anyone who denies the holocaust is just whacked. 

 
 Well technically, a "Holocaust" is the end of the world-- and we're still here, so that's out; literally, it means some sort of holy death-laser that destroys everything and everyone, and so far we've escaped the Death Star. Therefore you have to define "holocaust," since I DO deny that the world was destroyed.
 
 Now if you mean Hitler and the Nazis killing 6 million Jews internment at death-camps, then you'll also have to define "deny." 
 This can mean anyone who doesn't accept it blindly, and hasn't seen any precise, accurate data on it. Likewise, Hitler is purported to have killed larger numbers of Gentiles, so one might begin to question the emphasis on ethnicity.
 
 Naturally, controversy is the antithesis of objectivity-- as the Civil War proves; and therefore one would do well to remain additionally neutral and skeptical in sifting through the data. For example, history is written by the victors, while the stories of the vanquished are suppressed; therefore if someone says that others HAVE to believe the numbers and other allegations without a shred of proof other than films that show far less than six million people-- and likewise that show mostly people who obviously starved to death-- just like the 30-100 million others under socialism-- , and attempts to force others to admit and even believe it, then there's no reason for any rational person to tolerate that without question, let alone concur with it; rather, there's every reason to stand firm and demand proof.
 
 And if "it doesn't matter" whether whether 6 million or less than 6 million-- or by different causes, i.e. "it's just as bad either way," then there's certainly no harm in knowing the exact number and cause; and so much the more, if it IS better or worse, depending. Rather, denials of relevance seem to mask a hidden agenda.
 
 Likewise there's the matter of selective hypocrisy, i.e. decrying the deaths of a select group of 6 million under socialism as the ultimate evil, but showing convenient indifference to the 100+ million killed by socialism elsewhere in the same era. Once again, a hidden agenda is obvious.
 
 No rational, intelligent person will accept hype and rumor from an obviously biased source, but will demand precise, reliable and accurate information, not propoganda. Likewise, a savvy person will not kill the messenger, but will question his motive when the story doesn't add up.
Jo Bennett
Holocaust means a burnt offering, not the end of the world. Maybe you're thinking of Apocalypse?

What, are we supposed to do nothing and let that cancer regrow it's thousand heads all over again?
Jo Bennett

Free speech is easy to defend when you've never had any significant risk of a Nazi party gaining political power. The US doesn't need to limit hate speech because it places limits on the political process itself, which is effectively a legally mandated two-party system. In plural democracies as in most of Europe, given the history of those countries it is necessary to place limits on fascism. I really don't see how the prohibition of an outright and hateful lie is a serious restriction on anyone's rights.
Joel_Henderson

 Rights aren't about what's easy. They're about what's right.

In plural democracies as in most of Europe, given the history of those countries it is necessary to place limits on fascism.  Ignorance is no excuse, and blind ignorance is no exception. To quote William Pitt, "Necessity is the plea for every infringement of human freedom. It is the argument of tyrants; it is the creed of slaves." 
 Any twit can trump up some cockamamie justification for suppressing EVERY right; however that claptrap went out with the Alien and Sediction Acts of 1791.
CUNxTime

He's right, ANY curtailing of free speech is a dangerous, slippery slope that leads, inexorably, to less freedom and less democracy. Look at countries around the globe where there isn't free speech- in China you get Tienanmen Square, in the Islamic world if you deny Mohammad you get your head cut off, in Russia if you criticize the govt. you get a radio cocktail. 
 
 That is what you get when you head down the road of curtailed speech.
Jo Bennett

Strange, (west) Germany has had a restriction on Nazi parties and related iconography and propaganda for 60 years. They didn't have one before. Which situation resulted in the slaughter of 10 million people? Free speech is not an absolute, there are always some things it is not acceptable to say. I believe the US has concepts of "classified" about which it is illegal to speak, and I'm reasonably sure shouting fire in the crowded theatre is still covered by reckless endangerment, so don't come with the totally free speech argument unless you're prepared to argue against those laws as well.
 
 The slippery slope argument is falacious. There is no country in history that started with outlawing groups campaigning for mass genocide and by degrees ended up a police state. It just hasn't happened.
Joel_Henderson

 It's not just that-- it's just the arrogant audacity to claim that THEIR form of censorship, doesn't violate the right of free speech because it's SPECIAL circumstances blah blah blah; it's the typical Wilsonian "can't shout fire in a crowded theater" non-sequitur bull-shevism that simply rationalize a license to totalitarian suppression when it's THEIR issue being countered.
 
 This began with Lincoln arresting over 20,000 journalists who opposed him, and forcibly turning over 300 opposition-newspapers into propagnda-mills; all this was done in the same heinous rationalization; however Lincoln was clearly the most deranged lunatic in world history, stating at the same time that "Doing this I deem to be only a simple duty on my part, and I shall perform it so far as practicable unless my rightful masters, the American people, shall withhold the requisite means or in some authoritative manner direct the contrary--" while making that IMPOSSIBLE via suppressing all truth, freedom and right to assembly!
 
 For this reason, Lincoln was the worst tyrant in most deranged lunatic in history; unlike his later pupils like Lenin, Hitler, Stalin, Mao and Pol Pot, Lincoln claimed to serve the will of the PEOPLE-- while these others openly claimed and admitted to serve only the STATE, to which they likewise freely held that all persons were EXPENDIBLE.
 This made Lincoln worse in every way, in that he ended freedom through treachery and betrayal; the others simply maintained the status quo, doing as they said they would.
CUNxTime
